issue.title: crashlytics.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

labels.name: A: Waiting for data
labels.description: Waiting for more information from the user

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [http://crashlytics.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fcrashlytics.com) ### Comment > Crashlytics is blocked in AdGuard DNS filter despite comment stating to unblock it by ameshkov. > > ``` > ! Crashlytics is commented by ameshkov. > ! The reason for unblocking crashlytics is to not make developers life worse by breaking crash reporting. > ! In a hostile network like when an ad blocker is present, apps might be crashing, and these errors need to be > ! reported to devs, otherwise they won't learn about the issue and won't fix it. > ! Also, it is not a common third-party analytics tracker, Crashlytics is not used for collecting users' data. > ! ||e.crashlytics.com^ > ! ||settings.crashlytics.com^ > ``` > > The reasoning makes sense, it should probably be unblocked by default except in a stricter list. If not, comment should be updated to reflect new behavior. Username: `@metametapod` ### [NSFW] Screenshots
Screenshot 1 [Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/d1846pr33eo08sw8gsc8w8wwogwocwk436svtadwoo.png?nc=1)

When AdGuard first gave me the error message, I disabled AdGuard from within my browser for that specific site. Ctrl-F5 failed to give me the page. I then disabled the AdGuard for Windows, and Ctrl-F5 was fine. I then re-enabled thinking it was just a glitch. I eventually came to a page I needed to refresh, and the problem resumed. I then tried to report the error because I've had this problem intermittently for a while. And I got the exact same error message. I disabled AdGuard for Windows and then I was able to send this message. > Username: `@digging4roots` ### [NSFW] Screenshots
